name: SpecFlowPlus
description: Generate living documentation from your feature files or test assembly.
author: techtalk

inputs.name: generatorSource
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose a source to generate living documentation.

inputs.name: projectFilePath
inputs.label: Feature folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The folder containing the feature files.

The test project root folder if you want to include test execution results.

inputs.name: testAssemblyFilePath
inputs.label: Test assembly
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative or absolute path to the test assembly. Glob patterns are supported e.g.: `MyProject\**\MyProject.dll`

inputs.name: featureDataJsonFilePath
inputs.label: Feature data JSON
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative or absolute path to the feature data JSON. Glob patterns are supported e.g.: `MyProject\**\FeatureData.json`

inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the project visible in the viewer

inputs.name: testExecutionJson
inputs.label: Test Execution JSON paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative or absolute path(s) to the test execution JSON file(s) generated by the SpecFlow.Plus.LivingDocPlugin. Glob patterns are supported e.g.: `MyProject\**\TestExecution.json`

inputs.name: projectLanguage
inputs.label: Project Language
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the default language of your Gherkin files here.

inputs.name: workItemPrefix
inputs.label: Work Item Prefix
inputs.helpMarkDown: The special tag you mark the scenarios with to link them to the respecting work items

inputs.name: workItemUrlTemplate
inputs.label: Work Item URL Template
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The URL template to use to generate the external links.
Example: https://dev.azure.com/fabrikam/FabrikamProj/_workitems/edit/{id}

inputs.name: bindingAssemblies
inputs.label: Binding Assemblies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative or absolute path(s) to the binding assemblies. Glob patterns are supported e.g.: `MyProject\**\MyBindings.dll`

inputs.name: output
inputs.label: Output file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative (from the working directory) or absolute path to the generated output file.
